NEWS BITES

U.K. Report Finds Sellers May Opt Out of Estate Agent Services In order to cut down on moving costs, 42% of sellers in the U.K. report they would choose to avoid traditional estate agents and sell privately for their next move, according to GoCompare Home Insurance. Some 7.3 million future house sellers would also opt for an online agent or to sell privately. PropertyWire

‘Jeopardy!’ Host Alex Trebek Sells California Home Longtime ‘‘Jeopardy!’’ host Alex Trebek sold his 30-acre property on Lake Nacimiento, in California, for $1.3 million. Located in rural Paso Robles, the Ranchos del Lago property features a 2,595-square-foot house that came "fully furnished (except for artwork & personal possessions)," according to the listing. The San Luis Obispo Tribune

Comedian Whitney Cummings Lists Los Angeles, California, Home for $2 Million Comedian and actress Whitney Cummings is selling her architectural retreat in Studio City, California, for $2 million. She purchased the property in 2011 for $1.48 million. The 2,300-square-foot home, which is located in Wrightwood Estates, features three bedrooms and two-and-a-half bathrooms. Los Angeles Times

Singapore’s Ascott Opens First Co-Living Space for Millennials Singapore real estate group Capitaland’s The Ascott opened lyf Funan Singapore, a 121,000-square-foot, nine-story property with 279 apartments and 412 rooms. The co-living property, designed with millennials in mind, will offer social programs and collaborative spaces. Business Times
